content:
Prepping healthy snacks can make a huge difference in your daily habits and energy levels. Here are some substantial snack ideas that'll help you curb the coffee and cookie cravings:

**1.** **Energy Balls**: Mix rolled oats, nuts, seeds (e.g., chia, flax), and dried fruits with a bit of honey and nut butter (e.g., peanut butter). Roll into balls and refrigerate or freeze for up to 2 weeks.

**2.** **Roasted Chickpeas**: Rinse and dry a can of chickpeas. Toss with olive oil and your favorite spices (e.g., cumin, paprika, chili powder). Roast in the oven at 400°F (200°C) for 30-40 minutes, or until crispy. Season with salt and enjoy as a crunchy snack.

**3.** **Trail Mix**: Combine nuts (e.g., almonds, walnuts), seeds (e.g., pumpkin, sunflower), and dried fruits (e.g., cranberries, apricots) with a few dark chocolate chips (at least 70% cocoa). Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

**4.** **Protein-Rich Energy Bites**: Mix rolled oats, protein powder, nut butter, and honey. Roll into balls and refrigerate or freeze for up to 2 weeks.

**5.** **Hard-Boiled Eggs**: Boil a dozen eggs and keep them in the fridge for up to 5 days. A convenient protein-rich snack that's easy to take on-the-go.

**6.** **Apple or Banana Oat Bites**: Mix rolled oats, mashed banana or apple, and a bit of cinnamon. Roll into balls and refrigerate or freeze for up to 2 weeks.

**7.** **Spicy Edamame**: Steam or cook edamame according to package instructions. Toss with olive oil, salt, and your favorite spices (e.g., chili powder, cumin). Store in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

**8.** **Cottage Cheese Cups**: Mix cottage cheese with fruit (e.g., berries, sliced peaches) and a sprinkle of cinnamon. Store in small containers for up to 5 days.

**9.** **Whole-Grain Granola Bars**: Make your own granola bars with rolled oats, nuts, seeds, and dried fruits. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

**10.** **Veggie Sticks with Guacamole**: Prep a batch of guacamole on the weekend and store it in an airtight container for up to 3 days. Pair with carrot, celery, and cucumber sticks for a satisfying snack.

These snacks are designed to be filling, nutritious, and easy to grab-and-go. By prepping them on the weekends, you'll be more likely to reach for a healthy snack instead of coffee and cookies at work.
